intro: Acranthera athroophlebia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acranthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is known for its delicate, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
